comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Francis Bartram Towle (1896-1976), served in WWI; married Bessie Myra Talmadge (1893-1986) in 1918, in Connecticut. Both are buried in Oak Cliff Cemetery, Derby, New Haven CT. www.oxfordpast.net/oxfordpas/images/7c5000.jpg www.oxfordpast.net/oxfordpas/images/7c5000.jpg

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: He was the subject of an interesting story in the New York Times on April 25, 1915 when he arrived in New York on the White Star liner, Lapland at age 19, after having volunteered for the French Foreign Legion and served in the trenches. This was probably shot at that time. query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F50E11FD3C5D17738...

comment.author: 34904489@N07
comment._content:
pennylrichardsca and artolog:

Thanks for the backstory on this snappy dresser, Mr. Towle. We will add more details to the record when updating.
